channel.title: How do I call a Boolean for another file?
channel.description:
So in one file called "plugincommandExecutor" I have this [code] public static boolean toggle;[/code]
And I made a "ToggleCommand" class.
How would I make it so in ToggleCommand class I can have
toggle = true; or toggle = false;
I imported the file.. already not sure where to go after that.

item.title: How do I call a Boolean for another file?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“Kozs, post:3, topic:535025”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=653825.msg4379952#msg4379952 date=1383183459]
plugincommandExecutor.toggle = true;
plugincommandExecutor.toggle = false;

Or am I missing something?

Ps a good convention for Java programming is too capitalize your class names, i.e plugincommandExecutor should be PluginCommandExecutor
[/quote]

Well

Was the answer apparently[/quote]
When you declare something as static you declare that it belongs to the class, not a related object, and it is located in a fixed position in memory. Basically it’s available from anywhere (hence why you can call it from anywhere with just plugincommandExecutor.true/false).

Do a search for the relation between instance and class members and learn about the static modifier.

Disclaimer; I haven’t had anything to do with programming for over 4 years so what I told you may or may not be accurate, it’s just from memory so the terminology etc may be slightly off l0l)

Read full topic
item.source: How do I call a Boolean for another file?
